summary: This document appears to be a summary or excerpt from a legal filing referencing multiple lawsuits against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, including allegations of sexual misconduct, threats, and sex trafficking of minors at specific properties. It mentions settlements and a defamation case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary defendant in multiple lawsuits alleging sexual misconduct, threats, and sex trafficking of minors at his properties in New York and the Caribbean.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Co-defendant with Epstein in a 2017 lawsuit alleging she hired a woman to give massages to Epstein and later threatened her to comply with sexual demands.

persons.name: Alan Garten
persons.context: Denied allegations on behalf of Trump in relation to a suit that was dropped in November 2016.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Filed a defamation lawsuit against Epstein in Florida; the case was settled on the first day of trial in December 2018 with Epstein publicly apologizing.

connections.description: Co-defendants in a 2017 lawsuit alleging they hired a woman for massages and threatened her to comply with sexual demands.
Garten, as a Trump attorney, denied allegations in a suit involving Epstein that was dropped in 2016.
Edwards filed a defamation lawsuit against Epstein in Florida, which was settled in December 2018.

events.title: Suit Dropped
events.description: A lawsuit was dropped; Trump attorney Alan Garten denied allegations while Epstein declined to comment.

events.title: Lawsuit Filed Against Epstein and Maxwell
events.description: A woman filed a suit alleging Epstein and Maxwell hired her to give massages and threatened her to comply with sexual demands at Epstein's New York City mansion and private Caribbean island.

events.title: Settlement of 2017 Lawsuit
events.description: The 2017 lawsuit against Epstein and Maxwell was settled under undisclosed terms.

events.title: Bradley Edwards Defamation Trial Settled
events.description: A defamation lawsuit filed by attorney Bradley Edwards against Epstein was settled on the first day of trial in December 2018, with Epstein publicly apologizing; other terms were confidential.

locations: Epstein's mansion in New York City
9 East 71st Street (mansion where Epstein was accused of trafficking minors)
keyFacts: A 2017 lawsuit alleged Ghislaine Maxwell hired a woman to give massages to Jeffrey Epstein and later threatened her to comply with sexual demands at his New York City mansion and private Caribbean island, Little Saint James.
The 2017 lawsuit was settled in 2018 under undisclosed terms.
Attorney Bradley Edwards filed a defamation lawsuit against Epstein in Florida, which was settled on the first day of trial in December 2018 with Epstein publicly apologizing.
Epstein was accused of sex trafficking of minors at his mansion located at 9 East 71st Street.
A separate suit, in which Trump attorney Alan Garten denied allegations, was dropped on November 4, 2016.
